main.name: Sudip Karmacharya
main.description: I am graduating in the spring 2021. I am excited about what next there is to learn and experience.
main.bio: I am a mechanical engineer focusing on mechanical design, prototype fabrication, CAD modeling, Finite Element Analysis, and automation. I am passionate about designing and building interdisciplinary engineering solutions in a hands-on environment. I live by the ideas of self improvement in every facet of my life. My determination for excellence is complemented by a sense of humility to stay focused on my goals and learning.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.degree: Bachelor of Applied Science in Mechanical Engineering, Honours
description: Numberical Control of Machine Tools
Finite Element Methods
Autonomous Mobile Robots

Computer-Aided Design

Advanced Dynamics and Vibrations
Manufacturing Processes
Intorduction to Control Systems
Heat Transfer 1
Fluid Mechanics 1 & 2
Thermodynamics 1 & 2
Kinematics and Dynamics of Machines

work.title: Mechanical Designer
description: Simulated and analysed the dynamics of a helicopter docked on a ship deck at various sea and wind conditions using Numerical Analysis
Investigated specific cases with unexpected erratic motion and analysed the cause to mitigate it
Organised, developed and conducted tests for the implementation of new batteries for the helicopter docking and handling system, and ensured that the product reached the specification required
Generated new CAD models, assemblies and drawings of the next generation test rigs for the helicopter docking systems using

work.title: Mechanical Designer
description: Redesigned the existing the Cable Management System to supply power to the Automated Guided Vehicle (AGV). New design 25% cheaper, 49% smaller and 38% lighter while having doubled the cable capacity
Conducted FEA (SolidWorks Simulations) tests on various parts and assemblies to optimize weight and stress levels
Created CAD models, assemblies and drawings of systems of varying sizes using SolidWorks
Integrated various large components onto a 6 meter long AGV (Automated Guided Vehicle) in a safely and quickly

work.title: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) Designer
description: Designed various parts and assemblies using SolidWorks and AutoCAD with a focus on manufacturability
Used various fabrication methods namely; laser cutter, machining tools and, FFF/FDM and SLA 3D printers
Conducted FEA tests (SolidWorks Simulations) on various parts and assemblies to optimize weight and stress
Optimized the wing mount for minimum wing deflection while being cost effective and light as possible

work.title: 3D Print Centre Engineering Assistant
description: Operated and maintained production grade Fortus 360mc FFF/FDM 3D printers
Managed and tracked resources and finances of the facility using Microsoft Excel
Designed an enclosure for NaOH support remover using CATIA, resulting in a safer work-space
Improved operational efficiency} by creating an online order form, resulting in a decrease in order-to-production time by 60%

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
